definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: The small boat could not stem the rushing tide.
sentences.chinese: 這艘小船頂不住洶湧奔騰的潮水。

sentences.english: There is all this fresh stuff pouring through you.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙中存在着所有這類新鮮事，潮水般湧向蜂你。

sentences.english: I look the way of tidewater.
sentences.chinese: 我看了一下潮水的路線。

sentences.english: We watched the heavy outflow of the tide.
sentences.chinese: 我們觀看了洶湧奔出的潮水。

sentences.english: The fortunes of the Minmatars have ebbed and flowed continuously.
sentences.chinese: 米瑪塔爾人的財富一直在像潮水退朝一樣持續減少。

sentences.english: The tide washed in some broken spars.
sentences.chinese: 潮水衝來幾根折斷的桅杆。

sentences.english: According to Suetonius, he was showered with turnips thrown by his citizens.
sentences.chinese: 據蘇東尼斯稱，市民們用潮水般的蘿蔔襲擊了他。

sentences.english: While swimming you always need to be aware of rip tides and rip currents.
sentences.chinese: 當你游泳時需要意識到潮汐的時節和此時潮水的趨勢。

sentences.english: At this point, the square to participate in a get-together of people issued flood of cheers.
sentences.chinese: 此時，廣場上參加聯歡的民衆發出潮水般的歡呼聲。

sentences.english: As the flood clears to cider and shrinks a little.
sentences.chinese: 當潮水淨斂成蘋果酒且消縮少許。

sentences.english: I also find that coastal shots can be hard to plan for due to the constantly-changing tides.
sentences.chinese: 而且我知道海濱照片很難計劃，因爲潮水始終在變化。

sentences.english: Credit bubbles are like the tide. They can cover up a lot of rot.
sentences.chinese: 信貸泡沫猶如潮水，可以遮蓋許多腐敗的現象。

sentences.english: The tide has obliterated the footprints on the sand.
sentences.chinese: 潮水湮沒了沙上的足跡。

sentences.english: A bit not careful a moment that was submerged by the flood of ants.
sentences.chinese: 稍不留神，片刻之間，就被潮水般的螞蟻淹沒了。

sentences.english: Having a seafood dinner on deck along beach, enjoying a windy and peaceful night at Balai.
sentences.chinese: 晚風中，潮水聲中在浮腳長樓享用一頓海鮮大餐。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
a powerful current/a flood (often fig., e.g. a flood of ideas)
to spill/to overflow (of water, crowds)/to crowd (into a space)
(of a tide) to ebb or go out
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
